GENERAL OFFER CONDITIONS
1. This offer letter is hereby given to you as a pre-condition for the purchase of a house.
2. This offer letter is NOT indefinite, and may be nullified or rendered void if the conditions provided therein are not met.
3. A provisional letter of Allocation will be issued by Urban Shelter Ltd upon making a deposit of 30%.
4. Prior to handing over of keys, both parties shall execute sales agreement and other title Deeds.
5. Prospective buyers who have been provided an offer letter must make an initial deposit before a house is allocated.
6. A Deed of Assignment shall be provided to the owner/allotee upon completion of ALL payments.
7. The owner/allotees SHALL be responsible for all costs associated with the perfection of Land titles of the allotted property upon completion of the development.
8. The owner/allotee SHALL PAY ALL GOVERNMENT COSTS associated with their allotted property: these may include ground rent, taxes, assessment fees, levies, and ALL other property costs and fees due to the Federal Government of Nigeria, The Federal Capital Territory, and/or local/municipal authorities.
9. The payment of Government charges shall start immediately upon handing over of property to the owner/allotee.
10. The property allotted to the owner/allotee shall be used for residential purposes only.
11. Structural alterations of any sort shall not be carried out on the allotted property without the expressed written consent of URBAN SHELTER LTD (if during construction); any structural alteration after completion is prohibited, except by the approval of FCDA Development Control Unit.
12. Accepting this offer letter means accepting the terms of payment specified therein and the consequences in the event of default by the owner/allotee.
13. Urban Shelter shall NOT be held liable for delays in construction, which are caused by factors outside of its control; owners/allottees are expected to consistently make payments according to payment schedules.
14. Failure to meet the agreed payment schedules SHALL result in REVOCATION of the allotted property.
15. Allotees / Owners may request for refund of their deposits in writing, addressed to the MD/CEO of Urban Shelter, Ltd.
16. Refunds shall be given to customers after their allotted house has been repossessed and sold to another customer.
17. Defect Liability period is 6 months from the date of handover.
18. The owners / allottee shall commence payment of facility management fees once their house has been completed, and Urban Shelter has officially written to that effect (even if the owner / allottee has not moved into the house), as costs of maintenance are incurred even when houses are not occupied.
19. If the above conditions are found acceptable, please indicate so by appending your signature to this Offer Letter.
We thank you for the interest shown in our property and trust you will accept and ensure prompt compliance with the conditions of this offer. Please note that this offer is valid for 7 days.
Yours faithfully,
ENGR.BASHIR ABBA
GENERAL MANAGER
